prompt: <description>Part 1: A Rectangular Prism Step 1: Create the Coordinate System Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following parameters: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.75, 0.0] The z-axis of this coordinate system should be aligned with the normal of the sketch plane. Step 2: Draw the 2D Sketch Create a new 2D sketch on the XY plane of the coordinate system. Step 3: Create Faces and Loops Create a rectangle using the following lines: - Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.0479, 0.0] - Line 2: Start Point [0.0479, 0.0], End Point [0.0479, 0.2234] - Line 3: Start Point [0.0479, 0.2234], End Point [0.0, 0.2234] - Line 4: Start Point [0.0, 0.2234], End Point [0.0, 0.0] This sketch consists of one face (face_1) and one loop (loop_1) that encloses all four lines. Step 4: Scale the Sketch Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.2234 (sketch_scale). This will be applied along the normal direction of the sketch plane. Step 5: Extrude the Sketch Extrude the scaled sketch by 0.75 units along the normal direction of the sketch plane (extrude_depth_towards_normal). Specify an extrude_depth_opposite_normal of 0.0 to avoid any extrusion in the opposite direction. Step 6: Document the Description Document the following information in the description: - Shape: A rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The sides are parallel and the top and bottom faces are perpendicular to the sides. The dimensions of the prism are 2 units by 4 units by 6 units. - Length: 0.2234 - Width: 0.75 - Height: 0.2234 Use these instructions to construct a parametric CAD model based on the provided JSON data. This CAD model will represent a rectangular prism with the given dimensions.</description>
